A pilonidal sinus is a small hole or tunnel in the skin.
It typically develops in the crease at the top of the buttocks.
This condition is often caused by loose hairs penetrating the skin.
The sinus can become infected, forming a painful abscess or cyst.
Symptoms include pain, swelling, redness, and draining pus.
Treatment usually involves draining the abscess and sometimes surgery.
